refnamediv.refpurpose: window operator Compute aggregates over moving window

refsect1.title: Summary
refsect1.para: Compute one or more aggregates of any of an array's attributes over a moving window.

note.para: The AFL window operator provides the same functionality as the AQL SELECT ... FROM ... WINDOW statement. See the User's Guide chapter on Aggregates for more information.

informalexample.para: This example calculates a running sum for a 3×3 window on a 4×4 array. The window is multi-dimensional, with the same number of dimensions as the array, and is specified by a pair of values for each dimension, the "high" and "low" sizes. Each dimension of the window includes one cell for the "center", "high" number of cells above it, and "low" cells below it.

step.para:
Create an array called m4x4:
AFL% CREATE ARRAY m4x4 <val:double>[i=0:3,4,0,j=0:3,4,0];

Return the maximum and minimum values on a moving 3×3 window on m4x4: This window specification is a two-dimensional window of size 3x3, whose "center" is at the upper left corner of the 3x3 rectangle.
AFL% window(m4x4,0,2,0,2,max(val),min(val)); [ [(10,0),(11,1),(11,2),(11,3)], [(14,4),(15,5),(15,6),(15,7)], [(14,8),(15,9),(15,10),(15,11)], [(14,12),(15,13),(15,14),(15,15)] ]
